Date: January 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Indian-origin Kevan Parekh, appointed as the CFO of Apple effective January 1, 2025, will receive an annual salary of $1 million (₹8.57 crore).

  • Parekh joined Apple in June 2013 and has significant experience in finance roles.
  • He previously held leadership positions at Thomson Reuters and General Motors.
  • Parekh succeeds Luca Maestri in Apple's CFO transition plan.
  • Tim Cook praised Parekh's intelligence and judgment in his new role.
  • His annual compensation includes participation in Apple’s Executive Cash Incentive Plan with a target opportunity of 175% of base salary.

This appointment highlights Apple’s commitment to maintaining strong financial leadership during a key transition period.

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO GMP: Here's what grey market premium and subscription status signal ahead of listing | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO GMP and Subscription Update Ahead of Listing

Publication Date: January 5, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has shown overwhelming investor interest, being oversubscribed by 229.68 times overall. The listing is set for January 7, 2023, with a grey market premium indicating a potential listing price significantly higher than the IPO price.

Key Points:

  • IPO closed on January 2, 2023, with 1,94,53,89,519 shares bid for against 84,70,000 shares available.
  • Oversubscription rates: QIBs 242.40 times, NIIs 503.83 times, and retail investors 104.92 times.
  • Grey market price indicates a listing forecast at ₹311, a 44.65% rise from the IPO price of ₹215.
  • Fresh issue includes 86 lakh shares, with an OFS of 35 lakh shares.
  • Proceeds will be used for manufacturing capacity expansion, debt repayment, and investment in Barota Finance.
  • The IPO is valued at ₹260 crore, propelling market capitalization over ₹1,000 crore.
The grey market premium has seen a decrease from ₹99 on the allotment day to ₹96.

The strong demand for the Indo Farm Equipment IPO reflects robust investor confidence, with expectations of healthy performance upon its market debut.
newTitle: Indo Farm Equipment IPO GMP and Subscription Update Ahead of Listing

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted HDFC Bank permission to acquire up to a 9.5% stake in AU Small Finance Bank. The approval is valid for a year from January 3, 2025.

  • HDFC Bank is allowed to hold up to 9.5% of AU SFB’s paid-up share capital or voting rights.

title: Long-range cars spark up EV adoption drive - The Economic Times
summary:
Long-range cars spark up EV adoption drive

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Economic Times

India's electric car industry is on the verge of a transformation with a focus on long-range models, as consumers demand vehicles that can cover 300-680 km per charge. Declining battery costs and enhanced driving experiences, particularly in the SUV segment, are set to boost EV adoption beyond the current 2.5% market share.

  • 75% of electric vehicle buyers in 2024 preferred vehicles with a range of 300-500 km.
  • Top manufacturers plan to roll out at least 10 new EV models with ranges of 500-680 km by mid-2025.
  • The rising demand indicates that consumers see EVs as primary vehicles rather than just urban transportation.
  • Declining battery costs are enabling competitive pricing for higher-range vehicles.
  • Industry experts predict 2025 will be pivotal for EV adoption in India.
“Consumer interest, infrastructure development, and affordability are part of an interconnected ecosystem that's rapidly maturing.” - Ravi Bhatia, Jato Dynamics

The ongoing shift towards long-range electric vehicles marks a significant evolution in India's automotive landscape, hinting at broad future adoption and innovation in electric mobility.

The last month of 2024 was a busy period for primary market investors with 30 mainboard and SME IPOs launched in December, raising nearly ₹1.9 crore. 15 mainboard IPOs were listed, with a positive trend as 13 stocks traded higher than their IPO prices.

title: Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar? | Explained - The Hindu
summary:
Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar? | Explained

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The current bout of rupee depreciation is seen as driven primarily by the exit of foreign investors from India, which has put pressure on the rupee.

Introduction

In the last week of December 2024, the rupee breached the 85 mark against the U.S. dollar, reaching an all-time low of 85.81. The currency depreciated around 3% in 2024, continuing a long-term trend of declining value against the dollar.

Key Points

  • The value of a currency is determined by its demand and supply in the foreign exchange market.
  • Factors affecting currency depreciation include monetary policy, investor behavior, and demand for a country's goods and assets.
  • The recent fall in the rupee is primarily due to foreign investors exiting India amid a global market shift.
  • High inflation in India compared to the U.S. has put pressure on the rupee.
  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has used dollar reserves to stabilize the rupee's value.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

The value of India’s foreign exchange reserves dropped to an eight-month low of $640 billion as of the last week of December from over $700 billion in September.

Conclusion

Analysts suggest that the rupee's depreciation would have been sharper without RBI intervention, which aims to manage its value with minimal volatility.
newTitle: Understanding the Weakening of the Rupee Against the Dollar

title: Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained - The Hindu
summary:
Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained

Published: January 04, 2025, 11:05 pm IST

The article discusses the recent depreciation of the Indian rupee against the U.S. dollar, attributed mainly to foreign investor withdrawals and prevailing economic conditions.

  • The rupee breached the 85 mark against the U.S. dollar, reaching an all-time low of 85.81.
  • Factors affecting currency depreciation include monetary policy, foreign demand for goods, and inflation rates.
  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has intervened to support the rupee but foreign exchange reserves are at an eight-month low of $640 billion.
  • Long-term trends show the rupee's gradual depreciation is tied to high inflation rates compared to the U.S.
“Analysts believe the rupee’s depreciation would have been far worse if not for the RBI’s intervention to support the rupee against the dollar.”

In conclusion, the rupee's current depreciation reflects broader economic trends, investor behavior, and international monetary policy shifts, with implications for India's economic stability.
newTitle: Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained

title: Tata Motors breaks four-decade record, Punch tops sales in 2024 surpassing Maruti Suzuki’s Wagon R | Mint - Mint
summary:

Publication Date: 2024
Source: Autocar Pro

Tata Motors has surpassed Maruti Suzuki to lead car sales in India for the first time in 40 years, with its subcompact SUV, Tata Punch, achieving over 202,000 units sold in 2024.

  • Tata Motors sold 565,000 units in total, marking a fourth consecutive year of record sales.
  • The Punch outperformed Maruti Suzuki’s Wagon R and Swift.
  • Consumer preferences are shifting towards premium SUVs, pressuring Maruti Suzuki.
  • Maruti's market share dropped to 41% from 52% in 2018.
  • SUV segment sales grew by 19% in 2024.
“2024 marked the company’s fourth consecutive year of record-breaking sales.” - Shailesh Chandra, MD of Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd.

This achievement highlights Tata Motors' effective strategy in diversifying its SUV portfolio in response to evolving market demands.

title: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank shows strong deposit growth, modest loan book expansion in Q3 update - CNBCTV18
summary:
Ujjivan Small Finance Bank Reports Strong Deposit Growth in Q3 2025

Date: January 4, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

Ujjivan Small Finance Bank (USFB) showcased robust financial performance in its Q3 business update, revealing significant growth in deposits alongside a modest expansion of its loan portfolio.

  • Total deposits rose by 16% YoY, reaching ₹34,496 crore.
  • CASA deposits increased by 15% YoY, totaling ₹8,657 crore.
  • The credit-deposit ratio stood at 88%, down from 94% in the previous quarter.
  • Gross loan book expanded by 10% YoY, amounting to ₹30,466 crore.
  • Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio increased to 2.7%, up from 2.5% in the last quarter.
  • Collection efficiency remained strong at 96%.
  • Disbursements totaled ₹5,396 crore, a decrease of 6% from the previous year.

Total Deposits Up 16% YoY At ₹34,496 Cr Vs ₹29,669 Cr | CASA Up 15% YoY At ₹8,657 Cr Vs ₹7,556 Cr | Credit-Deposit Ratio At 88% Vs 94% | Gross Loan Book Up 10% YoY At ₹30,466 Cr Vs ₹27,743 Cr | GNPA At 2.7% Vs 2.5% QoQ & 2.1% YoY.

The bank's focus on low-cost deposits is indicated by the growth in CASA, contributing positively to its financial stability despite slight pressures on asset quality.
newTitle: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank Reports Strong Deposit Growth in Q3 2025

title: HDFC Bank's Q3 CASA deposits decline, advances show modest growth - CNBCTV18
summary:
HDFC Bank's Q3 CASA deposits decline, advances show modest growth

Date: January 4, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

HDFC Bank announced its third-quarter update, revealing a slight decline in CASA deposits while reporting moderate growth in gross advances.

  • Gross advances reached ₹2,54,250 crore, up 0.9% QoQ and 3% YoY.
  • Total deposits increased by 2.5% QoQ and 15.8% YoY, totaling ₹2,56,350 crore.
  • CASA deposits fell by 1.2% QoQ and 4.4% YoY, standing at ₹87,250 crore.
  • Time deposits saw a 4.6% increase, reaching ₹1,69,100 crore, up 22.7% YoY.
  • Assets Under Management (AUM) grew by 2.5% QoQ and 7.6% YoY to ₹2,62,760 crore.
  • Credit-deposit ratio slightly decreased to 99.18% from 100.76% in Q2.
  • RBI allowed HDFC Bank to acquire a 9.5% stake in Kotak Mahindra Bank and others.

Gross Advances Up 0.9% QoQ & 3% YoY At ₹25,425 Bn
Deposits Up 2.5% QoQ & 15.8% YoY At ₹25,635 Bn
CASA Deposits Down 1.2% QoQ & 4.4% YoY At 8,725 Bn
Time Deposits Up 4.6% QoQ & 22.7% YoY At ₹16,910 Bn
AUM Up 2.5% QoQ & 7.6% YoY At ₹26,276

This financial performance indicates a mixed trend for HDFC Bank, with steady advances but challenges in the CASA segment, suggesting a careful approach needed for future growth.

Researchers Uncover Nuclei Vulnerability Enabling Signature Bypass and Code Execution - The Hacker News
summary:
Researchers Uncover Nuclei Vulnerability Enabling Signature Bypass and Code Execution

Publication Date: September 8, 2024 | Source: The Hacker News

A high-severity security flaw has been disclosed in ProjectDiscovery's Nuclei scanner, which could allow attackers to bypass signature checks and execute malicious code.

  • Vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-43405.
  • CVSS score of 7.4 out of 10, affecting all versions after 3.0.0.
  • The flaw is rooted in discrepancies in signature verification and YAML parser handling.
  • Successful exploitation allows attackers to inject malicious content while maintaining valid signatures.
  • Addressed by ProjectDiscovery in version 3.3.2 released on September 4, 2024.
“Attackers could craft malicious templates containing manipulated # digest lines to bypass Nuclei's signature verification,” said Wiz researcher Guy Goldenberg.

This vulnerability poses a significant risk for organizations using Nuclei, as misuse of untrusted templates could lead to severe security breaches.
newTitle: Researchers Discover High-Severity Vulnerability in Nuclei Scanner

This initiative aims to empower startups and enhance India's position in the global market landscape.

title: Rs 48 crore a day! Meet the Indian CEO who became the world’s highest-paid employee - The Economic Times
summary:
Meet Jagdeep Singh: The World’s Highest-Paid Employee Earning Rs 48 Crores a Day

Publication Date: Recently Published | Source: Times of India

Jagdeep Singh, CEO of Quantumscape, has become the highest-paid employee globally, with an astonishing salary of Rs 48 crores daily, underscoring the impact of Indian talent in emerging industries.

Key Points

  • Jagdeep Singh's total annual income is Rs 17,500 crore.
  • He is recognized as a leader in the electric vehicle battery sector.
  • Singh’s educational qualifications include a B.Tech from Stanford and an MBA from UC Berkeley.
  • Quantumscape specializes in advanced solid-state batteries for electric vehicles.
  • Singh's leadership is pivotal in revolutionizing the EV industry.
“Jagdeep Singh’s extraordinary compensation package reflects the increasing value placed on technological advancements and clean energy solutions.”

Singh’s journey illustrates the power of innovation and leadership in technology, highlighting the potential for significant financial success in the renewable energy sector.
newTitle: Meet Jagdeep Singh: The World’s Highest-Paid Employee Earning Rs 48 Crores a Day
